column4: hi guys im getting this error The following packages have unmet dependencies:
and i cant install or remove software because of it
purge dont work
its trying to overwrite some libraries
from a previous version or something
computer janitor helped me when i had this issue once
but its not install
ed
i had this problem, i had to first remove the offending package from /var/cache/apt/archives then i did an update.
how do i find what to remove
well, if you run synaptic, or do what KNUBBIG said, you should see an error message with your problem package
ok so i removed the debs but it did not help anything :(
well what happened was i added a repository with a newer package to the apt-get and then tried to do an install but forgetting to run update, and somehow the two packages got mixed
now you will have to a) run sudo apt-get install -f, and then perhaps run a fix for dpkg, and then try and re-install whatever you where trying to install.
well it doesnt work
so what error does it give you? i have had to go as far as actually changing a log file...
trying to overwrite '/usr/lib/OGRE/Plugin_OctreeSceneManager.so', which is also in package libogremain-1.6.4 0:1.6.4.dfsg1-1
so any luck?
into /var/lib/dpkg/info and deleting everything that had that name and you may also have to go into /var/cache/apt/archives and do the same thing
oops, somehow i only copied part of that, did you getb the gist?
yah it worked like a charm thanks
